meanings.definition: Pertaining to or characteristic of literature.
meanings.sent1: The teacher praised the student's literary analysis of the novel.
meanings.sent2: She enjoyed attending the literary festival in town.
meanings.sent3: The cat tried to read a literary magazine but fell asleep on it instead.
meanings.sent4: Her mind was a library of literary treasures waiting to be explored.
meanings.sent5: The literary essence of the poem lingered in the air long after it was read.

meanings.definition: Engaged in or having the profession of literature.
meanings.sent1: The literary critic shared insightful reviews of the latest novels.
meanings.sent2: He dreamed of becoming a famous literary figure one day.
meanings.sent3: The literary editor accidentally spilled coffee on the manuscript.
meanings.sent4: Her pen danced across the page, leaving a trail of literary magic behind.
meanings.sent5: In her office, the walls were adorned with literary awards and accolades.

meanings.definition: Of or relating to books or writing.
meanings.sent1: The bookstore had a vast collection of literary works from different eras.
meanings.sent2: She found solace in the literary world during difficult times.
meanings.sent3: The literary club met every Thursday to discuss their favorite novels.
meanings.sent4: His words painted a literary landscape that transported readers to distant lands.
meanings.sent5: The library was a treasure trove of literary gems waiting to be discovered.
